title: Thy7ace
author: Thy7ace
content: The truth is that there's no easy way through it concerning merits, just click the beginners board all I could see is merely post concerning merit. Is like you guys are forgetting the purpose of this great forum it was created for Bitcoiners or cryptocurrencies lovers to interact and to gain more knowledge about cryptocurrencies. You guys should hold from the merit and focus on learning because if you continue with this getting of merit quick it may lead you to spamming which can affect any chance of you getting any merit. Just focus on the knowledge the forum already have for you with time eventually we will all Rank up. Those higher rank you're now where ones newbie they where patients enough to learn.

Almost everything you have said in this thread is true and I hope some newbies will find it useful. The truth is that everyone wants to be commended for their efforts and merits serve as a sign that your work is appreciated.  It is not bad to expect merit for your post but it becomes a problem when one becomes desperate to earn merits to rank up. This could lead to low-quality and sometimes irrelevant posts which could attract backlash and ignores. If you put up informative and relevant posts, merits will naturally flow. And quality post is a product of learning and creativity. I have seen some wonderful posts from newbies that have earned them a good amount of merits. But sadly a large number of newbies these days don't want to learn but they want to rank up overnight. Newbies should just be themselves and enjoy the forum. OP you have just three posts and all of them are threads you created. It shows that you are not even responding to the thread or following up based on the comments it generated. I suggest that you create fewer threads and learn more about Bitcoin and the forum.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: For over a year that I have spent on the forum, things have actually changed a lot, particularly in the aspect of talking about merit. In my newbie day, just around this time last year, it was a very big offense to so many members for a newbie to even mention merit, but this time around, there is not much attention to how newbies are frequently talking about merit. Maybe everyone has now become soft and less concerned, but if it continues like that, I think other newbies that will create accounts here and see the other merit thread will want to create there's too, and it might become a normal thing, but the side effects are that newbies will then become more concerned about earning merit and not making any positive contribution here.Op, your advice is good if you adopt it, and there are also a few newbies that will adopt the advice too, although many of them will also ignore it and do what pleases them.

To be fair towards the post-merit system newbies, it's harder now for them to rank up than it was in the past and before theymos introduced merits as a critical rank-up requirement. You didn't have to learn anything in the past, only your activity determined your forum rank. As long as your posts were good enough not to get deleted by the moderators, they remained and you gained activity, and ultimately rank. To advance in the forum hierarchy today, your posts need to matter for others to merit you.
